headline: Sleepy owl found resting among items on a New York antique store shelf - AP News
pitch: A sleepy owl, perched perfectly still on an antique shelf, is mistaken for a decorative piece until it slowly blinks, startling a browsing customer.

script.veo3_visual_prompt: A friendly, charismatic news anchor, mid-30s, sharp suit, sits at a sleek, modern news desk with glowing digital monitors in the blurred background. They smile warmly, almost imperceptibly amused, directly into the camera. CAMERA: Medium shot, static, slight tilt up. STYLE: Bright, professional studio lighting, clean, corporate feel. 9:16 vertical portrait aspect ratio.
script.dialogue: News Anchor: (professional, barely contained amusement) An owl found napping on an antique store shelf. We got the footage.
script.audio_cues: Upbeat, professional news theme music fades in, then fades slightly under dialogue. Subtle studio ambiance.

script.veo3_visual_prompt: An eccentric proprietor, 60s, wearing a dusty velvet jacket and thick glasses, stands proudly next to a tall, cluttered antique shelf. Perched stiffly among ornate teacups and tarnished figurines is a large, incredibly still owl, eyes half-closed. A long-suffering employee, 20s, in a wrinkled apron, slowly polishes a small, tarnished brass bell nearby, shooting exasperated glances at the owl, then a quick, deadpan look directly into the camera. CAMERA: Handheld medium shot, slight sway, focusing on the proprietor and owl, then cutting to the employee's reaction. STYLE: Warm, dusty, slightly chaotic antique store lighting. 9:16 vertical portrait aspect ratio.
script.dialogue:
Eccentric Proprietor: (boastful) A living curio. Very rare.
Long-Suffering Employee: (tired murmur) It just… showed up.
Eccentric Proprietor: (proudly) Excellent condition. Minimal dust.
Long-Suffering Employee: (to camera, deadpan) It's just a bird.
Eccentric Proprietor: (whispering conspiratorially) Only forty-five hundred.
script.audio_cues: Faint, distant street noise. Gentle tinkling of wind chimes. Occasional low 'hoo' from the owl. Soft, melancholic indie music score.
